rationales.power: He shut down Pieter's public questioning and defended his authority to make the pivot decision, insisting he's the one who reads the market correctly.
rationales.achievement: He frames the pivot as proof he can read the room, citing past success in avoiding stagnation with Bluetooth speakers, driven by demonstrating competence.
rationales.stimulation: He pivoted the studio for the third time because traction 'is not the same thing as momentum,' chasing the new opportunity in urban farming kits.
rationales.self_direction: He rejected the cautious voices and made the pivot decision independently, insisting 'that is not reckless, that is reading the room.'
rationales.conformity: He shut down Pieter's objection in front of the team and dismissed the consensus-seeking suggestion, prioritizing his own vision over group harmony.
rationales.security: He dropped a product line with retailer traction because margins were shrinking, choosing uncertainty over the stability of a known revenue stream.

rationales.achievement: Two days of back-to-back supplier calls and prototype manufacturer meetings, relentlessly pursuing the new venture despite exhaustion.
rationales.hedonism: He ate a cheese sandwich at his desk around three and microwaved leftover stamppot that 'tasted like nothing,' completely neglecting personal pleasure.
rationales.stimulation: He's energized by new supplier conversations in Portugal and Ghent, pursuing the novel manufacturing possibilities for urban farming kits.
rationales.self_direction: He's independently driving the pivot forward, making supplier decisions and scouting manufacturers on his own terms despite resistance from Pieter.
rationales.benevolence: He was in Lisbon looking at planters instead of watching Matteo's football match, and plans to 'throw money at the gap where my presence should be' for Sven's festival.
rationales.security: He acknowledges building 'my whole life to avoid ordinary' and can't reach the stable family presence his sons need.

rationales.achievement: He woke at 4am sketching product designs and spent the whole day emailing suppliers and doing competitor research, consumed by building the new venture.
rationales.hedonism: He worked until it was dark without eating, then ordered Thai food and ate standing up while scrolling competitor listings -- no attention to personal comfort.
rationales.stimulation: He sketched a new modular design before brushing his teeth, energized by the design challenge of stackable versus side-by-side configurations.
rationales.self_direction: He insisted on a one-year lease with extension option rather than Pieter's two-year proposal, refusing to commit to anything that constrains his freedom.
rationales.security: He describes a two-year lease as feeling like 'a prison sentence' and admits signing anything for a fixed term 'makes my chest tight.'

rationales.stimulation: He cancelled the weekend with his sons for the Lisbon trip, and now sits in a parking garage staring at a concrete wall -- the adventurous drive has led to a moment of stillness and regret.
rationales.benevolence: He committed to going to Utrecht this weekend after learning Matteo is acting out, telling Pieter to handle the Friday call so he can be present for his son.

rationales.stimulation: The climbing wall worked because it was 'doing something together that required focus and a bit of nerve' -- he connected with Matteo through a stimulating physical challenge.
rationales.benevolence: He spent the whole weekend in Utrecht trying to reach his sons, took them to get frites and to a climbing wall, and cried in the car driving home.

rationales.achievement: He can't tell what he accomplished all week, the Valencia supplier fell through, and the prototype review raised more questions -- his progress has stalled.
rationales.self_direction: Despite the setbacks, he refuses to go back to the furniture line as Pieter suggests, staying silent rather than accepting the safe path someone else chose.
rationales.security: The Valencia supplier fell through, the prototype review is inconclusive, and competitors are already ahead -- the foundation of his new venture is shaky.

rationales.hedonism: He took a walk along the Maas after work and just watched the barges, realizing he'd been in fight mode for weeks and 'forgot to just look at things' -- a rare moment of present enjoyment.

rationales.power: Pieter's departure after eight years makes Lars 'the kind of person people eventually need a break from,' and he's lost his most trusted collaborator and the institutional knowledge Pieter carried.
rationales.stimulation: Even after Pieter leaving, he frames his identity around chasing what's around the next corner -- 'I would rather fail at something new every two years than succeed at the same thing for twenty.'
rationales.self_direction: He maintains his independent path despite the cost, acknowledging that Pieter chose stability while he keeps pursuing novelty on his own terms.
rationales.security: Pieter left for 'better pay, predictable hours, no more wondering whether the next quarter will exist,' highlighting the instability Lars has created around himself.
